summary: U.S. manufacturers export billions of dollars' worth of airplanes and other aviation products each year. Exported products require safety approvals from both the exporting and the importing country. Manufacturers told us it's hard to predict how long other countries will take to approve their products. They also said countries are requesting more data and extending timelines, and the Federal Aviation Administration is short-staffed—affecting how much...
title: Aviation Certification: FAA Should Evaluate Effectiveness of the International Validation Process
